ai.summary: An easy 5.8 km section of the Green Chain Walk in the UK, suitable for most casual walkers. The route mixes urban paths, parkland, and gentle riverside sections, with flat to gently undulating terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat with well-maintained footpaths. Expect a mix of paved urban paths, compact gravel, and grassy sections; occasional stairs or steps; possible mud after rain. Watch for street crossings and cyclists on shared routes.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours before setting out. Some sections run along roads with traffic; stay aware of vehicles and cyclists. Keep to path edges in wet conditions to avoid mud and slipping. Carry a map or offline navigation, a charged phone, and emergency contact information. If walking with others, share your ETA.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or lightweight boots
Map or offline navigation (or GPS device)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) offers the best weather and daylight. Winter walks are possible with proper warm clothing and rain protection.

seo.meta_description: Explore Green Chain Walk Section 4B, an easy 5.8 km hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and gear for a comfortable day on the trail.
